victim.name: Altair Draven
victim.occupation: A seasoned security officer aboard the deep space mining station, responsible for maintaining order and protecting valuable resources from internal and external threats.
victim.personality: Stoic and unemotional, Altair is known for his calm demeanor under pressure and unwavering dedication to his duties, rarely showing his feelings even in the direst situations.
victim.cause_of_death: Killed by a heavy mining rig component dislodged intentionally and dropped onto him, a sabotage meant to eliminate the station’s security oversight.

profile.name: Lyra Striker
profile.description: A trusted scientist dedicated to unraveling the mysteries of the mining station's unique mineral composition. Lyra's loyal nature keeps her focused on the greater good, even as tensions rise aboard the cold metal corridors.
profile.relationship_to_victim: Research collaborator who often consulted with Altair on security measures for sensitive areas.

original_mmo.means: Lyra manipulated the mining rig's safety controls to release a heavy component directly above Altair, causing it to fall and fatally strike him during his routine security inspection.
original_mmo.motive: Lyra feared that Altair’s strict enforcement would expose her hidden research on the station’s mineral exploitation secrets, which could lead to shutdown or confiscation, jeopardizing her life's work.
original_mmo.opportunity: As a research collaborator, Lyra had authorized access to the rig’s control systems and was present in the nearby control room during Altair’s security rounds, giving her the chance to sabotage the equipment unnoticed.

profile.name: Orin Orwell
profile.description: An uneasy educator tasked with training the new recruits on safety protocols within the hazardous mining environment. Orin's anxious demeanor masks a deep fear of the station’s escalating internal conflicts.
profile.relationship_to_victim: Station instructor who had frequent run-ins with Altair over discipline and protocol.

original_mmo.means: Orin used his knowledge of the safety protocols and access to the rig maintenance schedules to deliberately loosen a heavy mining rig component so that it would fall when Altair was below, ensuring the sabotage appeared as an accident.
original_mmo.motive: Orin resented Altair's constant harsh discipline and feared being exposed for his own lapses in safety training; his anxiety twisted into obsession, driving him to remove Altair to stop the pressure and criticism.
original_mmo.opportunity: As the station instructor, Orin had access to the mining rig control areas during routine training sessions and shifts, allowing him to tamper with the equipment shortly before Altair's fatal inspection round.

modified_mmo_elements.original_element_description: Orin resented Altair's constant harsh discipline and feared being exposed for his own lapses in safety training; his anxiety twisted into obsession, driving him to remove Altair to stop the pressure and criticism.
modified_mmo_elements.modified_element_description: Although Orin was uneasy about Altair's strict discipline, he was more motivated by a desperate hope to improve safety standards and prevent accidents, showing no actual personal grudge or obsession against Altair.
modified_mmo_elements.reason_for_modification: By removing the personal grudge and obsession, Orin's motivation to harm Altair is significantly weakened, making him less likely to have intended harm despite plausible means and opportunity.

profile.name: Axel Maddox
profile.description: A relentless security enforcer with a stoic presence that commands respect among the crew. Axel's unemotional facade hides his true ambitions to inherit control after Altair’s removal.
profile.relationship_to_victim: Junior security officer desiring Altair’s position and authority aboard the station.

original_mmo.means: Axel manipulated the station's mining rig controls to dislodge a heavy component above Altair's usual patrol route, causing it to fall and fatally strike him, appearing as a tragic accident in the hazardous environment.
original_mmo.motive: Eager to ascend to the lead security officer position, Axel saw eliminating Altair as the only way to advance his ambitions and gain full control over the station's security operations.
original_mmo.opportunity: As a fellow security officer, Axel had regular access to the mining rig controls during shift changes and was present near the rigging area shortly before the accident occurred, providing the perfect moment to sabotage the equipment unnoticed.

modified_mmo_elements.original_element_description: Axel manipulated the station's mining rig controls to dislodge a heavy component above Altair's usual patrol route, causing it to fall and fatally strike him, appearing as a tragic accident in the hazardous environment.
modified_mmo_elements.modified_element_description: While Axel had access to the mining rig controls, an automated security audit revealed the system was locked and unreachable during his shift due to maintenance protocols, making it impossible for him to manipulate the equipment at the time of the incident.
modified_mmo_elements.reason_for_modification: The security audit proving Axel could not access the controls at that critical moment removes his ability to directly cause the fatal accident.

evidence_items.description: Log records from the mining rig's control system show unauthorized commands issued from Lyra Striker's access credentials shortly before the heavy component was released.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: This proves Lyra had both the capability and technical means to manipulate the rig's safety controls remotely.

evidence_items.description: Security camera footage captures Lyra lingering near the control room during Altair Draven’s inspection, with no justifiable reason for her extended presence.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: Being physically nearby at the moment of the sabotage gave Lyra the opportunity to carry out the fatal act undetected.

evidence_items.description: Confidential station reports reveal Lyra’s deep anxiety about Altair’s inspections potentially exposing her sensitive mineral research experiments.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: This fear provides a strong motive for Lyra to eliminate Altair to protect her secret work and avoid shutdown.

evidence_items.description: Forensic analysis found fingerprint smudges matching Orin Orwell on the malfunctioning mining rig control panel shortly before the accident.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: This suggests Orin had physical access and ability to tamper with equipment, supporting his means to cause the accident.

evidence_items.description: Several trainees testified that Orin exhibited nervous behavior and avoided Altair, implying a tense relationship during safety drills.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: This behavior superficially points to resentment and pressure Orin felt from Altair, hinting at a possible motive.

evidence_items.description: Fingerprint analysis found Axel's prints on the panel adjacent to the mining rig controls, indicating recent physical interaction with the equipment area.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: Though direct control was locked, his prints suggest proximity and potential intent to manipulate the controls.

evidence_items.description: Witness reports note Axel expressing frustration about Altair's promotion and leadership style days before the accident, highlighting his strong desire to take over the lead security role.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: These statements support Axel's original motive of wanting to remove Altair for career advancement.
